title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: In the Java Perspective, open a java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench. Right-click on the same Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. Nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message stating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message stating that you should close all files first. We believe this is a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
SR: To reproduce the issue, make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window should pop up with the java file opened. Close it. Go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. Nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message stating that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message stating that you should close all files first. We believe this is a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
